citations.narrative:
In one of the enclosures shaded by a tree, the outdoor area of the sheltered housing (barn with outdoor enclosure)
standing water was present from the misting system. The misting system covered multiple outdoor portions of different
enclosures. In this specific enclosure the accumulation of water around the base of the tree did not allow the hybrid dogs
housed within to transition from the sheltered to the outdoor areas of the enclosure without getting their feet wet and
contaminating their feet with mud. Housing facilities must rapidly eliminate water to allow the animals to stay dry, and
standing puddles of water in animal enclosures must be drained or addressed. In the food preparation area, the trash
container had a broken swinging lid. Trash containers in housing facilities and food preparation areas must be leakproof
and must have tightly fitted lids on them at all times. Housing facilities must be operated in a manner that minimizes
contamination and disease risks.
Correct by 15 August 2024

Several enclosures in the sheltered housing facility did not have impervious surfaces for the walls in contact with the
animals. In sheltered housing facilities, impervious surfaces are required for all walls, boxes, houses, dens and other
surfaces in contact with the animals to facilitate sanitation. The plywood walls cannot be cleaned and sanitized as
required in the regulations.
Correct by 31 August 2024

The schedule for sampling and treatment of parasites and other pests was not performed in accordance with the schedule
approved by the attending veterinarian in the program of veterinary care for dogs. The wolf dog hybrids had annual
veterinary exams performed and the vet recommended heartworm and fecal testing for every animal, in accordance with
the schedule in the written program of vet care for dogs, and the schedule was not followed. Exhibitors must follow the
schedule for sampling and treatment of parasites and other pests (including fleas, worms coccidia, giardia, and
heartworm) approved by the attending veterinarian in the program of veterinary care.
Correct by 31 August 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative and the President over the phone.
